Requirement_Text: NN failure shall not prevent safe flight and landing
Rationale: Single point of failure is unacceptable for flight safety

Requirement_Text: Dual-redundant neural processors for DAL A systems
Cross-channel comparison with disagreement detection
Independent safety monitor using conventional algorithms
Automatic fallback to conventional system on NN failure
Failure annunciation to crew within 1 second
Runtime monitoring for all DAL A/B/C NN systems
Confidence monitoring with thresholds per DAL
OOD detection for all NN inputs
Rationale: Prevent unpredictable behavior outside training distribution

Requirement_Text: Performance metrics tracked in real-time
Anomaly detection for unusual NN behavior
Manual override always available to crew
Override activation time less than 2 seconds
Rationale: Crew must be able to respond quickly

Requirement_Text: Clear indication of override status
Override maintains aircraft in safe state
Graceful degradation to conventional systems
Multi-level degradation modes defined
Smooth transitions between degradation levels
Crew awareness maintained during degradation
Explainability for safety-critical NN decisions
Rationale: Support crew understanding and incident investigation

Requirement_Text: Explainability algorithms implemented (SHAP/LIME)
Crew training on explanation interpretation
Rationale: Ensure crew can use explanations effectively

Requirement_Text: Explanations logged in flight data recorder
Training data representativeness validated
Rationale: Ensure NN trained on appropriate data

Requirement_Text: Training data covers greater than 99% of ODD
Bias testing across operational domain
Independent expert review of dataset
Model performance meets safety objectives
Accuracy greater than 99.9% on test set (DAL A/B)
No failures on safety-critical corner cases
Graceful degradation beyond ODD
Independent validation confirms performance
Safety monitor detects NN failures
Safety monitor detection rate greater than 99%
False alarm rate less than 0.01 per flight hour (DAL B)
Detection latency less than 100ms
Hardware redundancy for DAL A systems
Rationale: Prevent hardware single point of failure

Requirement_Text: Physically separate processors for redundant channels
ECC memory for all NN processors
Built-in test (BIT) for hardware health
Software verification for NN inference code
Code review by independent team
Unit testing with 100% code coverage
Formal methods for critical paths (where practical)
Model versioning and configuration management
Cryptographic verification of model weights
Version tracking for models and datasets
Startup BIT verifies correct model loaded
Adversarial robustness for exposed NN systems
Adversarial training applied during model development
Input sanitization and validation
Crew training on NN systems
Ground school covering NN fundamentals and systems
Simulator training with nominal and failure scenarios
Line training with supervised NN operations
Documentation for NN systems
Flight crew operating manual (FCOM) procedures
Aircraft maintenance manual (AMM) for NN systems
Minimum equipment list (MEL) for NN systems
Safety assessment reports (FHA FMEA FTA CCA)
Model cards and dataset cards
Continuous monitoring and improvement
Operational data collection and analysis
Incident investigation and corrective action
Periodic revalidation and model updates
